fields.name: actions
fields.description: A general purpose paginated endpoint to explore the actions.

fields.name: generativeTokens
fields.description: Generic endpoint to query the Generative Tokens. Go-to endpoint to explore the Generative Tokens published on the platform, requires pagination and provides sort and filter options. *Flagged tokens are NOT excluded by this endpoint*.

fields.name: generativeToken
fields.description: Get a Generative Token by its ID or SLUG. One of those 2 must be provided for the endpoint to perform a search in the DB.

fields.name: randomGenerativeToken
fields.description: Returns a random Generative Token among all the available Generative Tokens. This implementation does not guarantee that a Generative Token will be outputted altough the chances for a NULL value to be returned are really low.

fields.name: randomTopGenerativeToken
fields.description: Returns a random Generative Token among the 20 most successful tokens by tezos volume on the marketplace in the last 24h

fields.name: objkts
fields.description: Generic paginated endpoint to query the gentks. Filtrable.

fields.name: objkt
fields.description: Endpoint to query a single gentk, using different trivial search criteria (id, hash or slug).

fields.name: reveal
fields.description: Endpoint to reveal the seed of a gentk from the hash of the mint transaction.

fields.name: listings
fields.description: The go-to endpoint to explore Listings on the marketplace. This endpoint both returns Listings made on the old and new marketplace contracts. **By default, only returns active listings (not accepted nor cancelled)**

fields.name: listingsByIds
fields.description: Given a list of Listing identifiers (ID + contract-version), outputs the associated listings.

fields.name: users
fields.description: Some unfiltered exploration of the users, with pagination.

fields.name: user
fields.description: Find a user by it's ID (tezos address) or by it's name as they set it on the fxhash user register.

fields.name: randomTopCollectors
fields.description: Returns a selection of the top collectors by primary and secondary purchases in number or volume in the last week

fields.name: statusGentkAssignation
fields.description: Get the assignation status of a particular gentk, identified by its ID.

fields.name: statusAssignation
fields.description: Returns the current assignation status with different metrics

fields.name: statusIndexing
fields.description: The status of the indexer

fields.name: moderationReasons
fields.description: A list of the moderation reasons

fields.name: article
fields.description: Get an Article by its ID or SLUG. One of those 2 must be provided for the endpoint to perform a search in the DB.

fields.name: articles
fields.description: Generic endpoint to query the Articlres. Requires pagination and provides sort and filter options.

fields.name: mintTicket
fields.description: Get a Mint Ticket by its ID

fields.name: mintTickets
fields.description: Generic endpoint to query Mint Tickets, requires pagination and provides sort and filter options.

fields.name: redeemable
fields.description: Returns a Redeemable entity, identified by its address

fields.name: redeemables
fields.description: Returns a list of Redeemable entities, sorted by creation time

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Action
types.description: A polymorphic entity which describes actions made by users on the platform.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A random ID associated with the action during the indexing process.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of the action. Different action types will have different fields populated.

fields.name: numericValue
fields.description: A numeric value associated with the action. Sometimes this numeric value can also be found in the metadata, but it's easier to store it to perform operations directly on the field in the DB. Not all the actions have a direct numericValue associated with them.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time at which the action was registered on the blockchain, ie the time of the block when the operation was registered.

fields.name: opHash
fields.description: The operation hash corresponding to the action.

fields.name: issuer
fields.description: The user entity which is at the origin of the action. It has a slightly different meaning for each action.

fields.name: target
fields.description: The target entity which is the at the receiving side of the action. It has a different meaning for each action.

fields.name: token
fields.description: The generative token associated with the action. Some actions, even though they are related to a generative token, doesn't have this field populated as it's only populated if really meaningful to store it.

fields.name: objkt
fields.description: The gentk associated with the action. Some actions, even though they are related to a generative token, doesn't have this field populated as it's only populated if really meaningful to store it.

fields.name: article
fields.description: The article associated with the action, if any.

fields.name: redeemable
fields.description: The redeemable associated with the action, if any.

types.name: ActionType
types.description: The type of the action

types.name: JSONObject
types.description: The `JSONObject` scalar type represents JSON objects as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

types.name: User
types.description: Polymorphic entity which globally describes regular users (who had at least one interaction with fxhash contracts) or contract entities such as a collaboration contract.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier (tezos address) of the user.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the user, as it was set in the fxhash user register contract by the user.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of account. The User entity is a polymorphic entity which both support regular users and "contract" users. For instance, if this field returns `COLLAB_CONTRACT_V1`, it means that the account in question is a collaboration contract controlled by the users found in the `collaborators` field.

fields.name: flag
fields.description: If any, the flag that was set by the moderation team. Verified users will have a `VERIFIED` flag.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: The metadata of the user in JSON, extracted from IPFS as they saved it on the fxhash user register contract. *Please use individual fields if possible as it makes cheaper responses*.

fields.name: metadataUri
fields.description: The IPFS uri pointing to the given user metadata.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the user, as set in the IPFS json metadata associated to the user on the fxhash user register contract.

fields.name: avatarUri
fields.description: The IPFS uri pointing to the avatar of the user as set in the json metadata associated to the user on the fxhash user register contract.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time at which this user first interacted with one of the indexed fxhash contracts.

fields.name: account
fields.description: The account associated with the user.

fields.name: authorizations
fields.description: Users can have granular moderation rights to certain features on the fxhash contracts. This field outputs a list of those authorizations in a human readable way.

fields.name: reserves
fields.description: Returns the list of generative tokens with active reserves including the user.

fields.name: objkts
fields.description: The gentks owned by the user. Can be used to explore their collection using various filters.

fields.name: avatarMedia
fields.description: The media entity associated with the user avatar, provides additional informations on the avatar such as resolution, base64 placeholder and media type.

fields.name: generativeTokensFromObjktFilters
fields.description: Given a list of filters to apply to a user's collection, outputs a list of Generative Tokens returned by the search on the Gentks, without a limit on the number of results.

fields.name: entireCollection
fields.description: Returns the entire collection of a user, in token ID order

fields.name: mintTickets
fields.description: Returns mint tickets owned by the user, in token ID order

fields.name: authorsFromObjktFilters
fields.description: Given a list of filters to apply to a user's collection, outputs a list of Authors returned by the search on the Gentks, without a limit on the number of results.

fields.name: generativeTokens
fields.description: Returns the tokens authored by the user, either directly or as a collaboration through a collaboration contract.

fields.name: articles
fields.description: The Articles authored by the user.

fields.name: articlesOwned
fields.description: The Articles owned by the user.

fields.name: listings
fields.description: The Listings created by the user. By default, this endpoint only returns the active Listings (not cancelled not accepted). **This endpoint should only be used on a single user at once as it has not been optimized for batch yet**.

fields.name: offersSent
fields.description: Returns all the offers made by the user. Can be filtered.

fields.name: allOffersSent
fields.description: Returns all the offers and collection offers made by the user. Can be filtered.

fields.name: offersReceived
fields.description: Returns all the offers made by users on tokens owned by the given user.

fields.name: allOffersReceived
fields.description: Returns all the offers and collection offers received by the user. Can be filtered.

fields.name: collaborationContracts
fields.description: If the user is a regular user account, returns its list of collaboration contracts created on the fxhash collaboration contract factory.

fields.name: collaborators
fields.description: If the user is a collaboration contract, this endpoint will return the list of collaborators on the contract.

fields.name: actions
fields.description: The actions in which the user is either the issuer or the target. Paginated, can be filtered and sorted.

fields.name: sales
fields.description: The secondary market sales in which the user is involved as a recipient (either as the direct seller or as an artist)

fields.name: moderationReason
fields.description: If any, returns the moderation reason associated with the user

types.name: UserType
types.description: What type of entity is this user (regular, collab... etc)

types.name: UserFlag
types.description: Flag of the user

types.name: Account
types.description: Represents a user account on the platform

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the account.

fields.name: username
fields.description: The username of the account. This field is nullable because the user may not have set a username yet.

types.name: UserAuthorization
types.description: Some users have granular authorizations to perform certain moderation actions on the contracts.

types.name: GenerativeToken
types.description: A Generative Token is a project published by artist(s), responsible for generating unique iterations (gentk)

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the Generative Token, matches the blockchain storage

fields.name: version
fields.description: The version of the Generative Token - PRE_V3 = tokens minted before the fx(params) contract upgrade.

fields.name: slug
fields.description: URL-friendly unique string identifier to reference the Generative Token. Computed on-the-fly by the indexer.

fields.name: flag
fields.description: Generative Tokens can be reported or moderated and their moderation state will reflect in this property.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the Generative Token, as defined in the JSON metadata created with the token when published on the blockchain

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: The JSON metadata of the Generative Token, loaded from the ipfs uri associated with the token when published

fields.name: paramsDefinition
fields.description: The JSON fx(params) definition for project using params

fields.name: metadataUri
fields.description: IPFS uri pointing to the JSON metadata of the Generative Token

fields.name: generativeUri
fields.description: IPFS uri pointing to the web page hosting the Generator code. **Can be used to display generated gentks**

fields.name: thumbnailUri
fields.description: IPFS uri pointing to the 300x300 (contained) thumbnail of the project

fields.name: displayUri
fields.description: IPFS uri pointing to the full res image of the project

fields.name: tags
fields.description: A list of tags as defined by the artist(s) when published. Can be used to better reference the project.

fields.name: labels
fields.description: A list of int identifiers defining some properties of a Generative Token. Can be set by artist(s) at mint time and can be upadted by moderators on-chain if needed.

fields.name: originalSupply
fields.description: The initial supply, as defined by artist(s) when publishing the Generative Token

fields.name: supply
fields.description: The current supply, some editions can be burnt by the artist(s) and in that case this number will be smaller than *originalSupply*

fields.name: balance
fields.description: The balance left (the number of iterations still mintable). When 0, the Generative Token cannot be used to generate new iterations.

fields.name: iterationsCount
fields.description: The number of iterations minted from the Generative Token - defined for V3 tokens only.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: If the minting of the Generative Token is enabled or not. Can be changed by artist(s) only onchain.

fields.name: royalties
fields.description: The current royalties which will be attributed to the iterations minted from this token. Can be updated by artist(s). Per thousands (divide by 10 to get percentage).

fields.name: lockedSeconds
fields.description: The number of seconds during which the Generative Token is locked after it was published. Verified users will have 0 lockedSeconds.

fields.name: lockEnd
fields.description: When will the lock of the token ends. Is defined by *createdAt* + *lockedSeconds*

fields.name: mintOpensAt
fields.description: When the token will be available for minting. Is defined by max(lockEnd, pricing.opensAt)

fields.name: openEditions
fields.description: Whether the token has open editions or not.

fields.name: openEditionsEndsAt
fields.description: For tokens with open editions - indicates when the open editions end. Null if the open editions never end.

fields.name: inputBytesSize
fields.description: The number of bytes required to mint an iteration of the project (if 0, no fxparams)

fields.name: previewInputBytes
fields.description: The fx(params) input bytes which produce the token preview

fields.name: issuerContractAddress
fields.description: The address of the issuer contract that this token was issued from.

fields.name: gentkContractAddress
fields.description: The address of the gentk contract that this token will mint iterations on.

fields.name: codex
fields.description: The Codex of the token.

fields.name: objkts
fields.description: Get the unique iterations generated from the Generative Token. This is the go-to endpoint to get the gentks as it's the most optimized and is built to support sort and filter options.

fields.name: captureMedia
fields.description: The media entity associated with the capture image taken by the artists, provides additional informations on the capture such as resolution, base64 placeholder and mime type.

fields.name: entireCollection
fields.description: The whole gentks belonging to the Generative Token. **This endpoint must be used with moderation as the fetch can be expensive if ran on many Generative Tokens**.

fields.name: activeListedObjkts
fields.description: The list of gentks on which a listing is currently active. *Due to some optimization factors, this endpoint can't be called on multiple Generative Tokens at once*.

fields.name: offers
fields.description: Returns a list of offers on individual gentks associated with a collection

fields.name: collectionOffers
fields.description: Returns a list of collection offers for the token

fields.name: allOffers
fields.description: Returns all the offers and collection offers associated with a generative token

fields.name: pricingFixed
fields.description: The PricingFixed entity associated with the Generative Token. *It can be null if the Generative Token uses a different pricing strategy*.

fields.name: pricingDutchAuction
fields.description: The PricingDutchAuction entity associated with the Generative Token. *It can be null if the Generative Token uses a different pricing strategy*.

fields.name: splitsPrimary
fields.description: The list of splits on the primary market

fields.name: splitsSecondary
fields.description: The list of splits on the secondary market

fields.name: reserves
fields.description: The reserves of the Generative Token. Artists can define reserves to control the distribution of their tokens.

fields.name: objktsCount
fields.description: The number of objkts generated by the Generative Token

fields.name: redeemables
fields.description: A list of Redeemable Smart Contracts associated with this token

fields.name: reports
fields.description: A list of the reports made on the Generative Token

fields.name: author
fields.description: The account who authored the Generative Token. Due to how collaborations are handled, it is also required to fetch the eventual collaborators on the account to know if it's a single or multiple authors.

fields.name: actions
fields.description: A list of all the actions related to the Generative Token. **Not optimized to be run on multiple generative tokens at once, please use carefully*.

fields.name: marketStats
fields.description: The pre-computed marketstats of the Generative Token. *Please note that those stats may not be in perfect sync with up-to-date data due to optimization reasons*. Please refer to the **{ to }** field to see when the data was last computed.

fields.name: marketStatsHistory
fields.description: The history of the market stats over time. Can be used to build **GGGG-G-GG-GGGRAPH**

fields.name: features
fields.description: **[HEAVY - please no abuse]** Returns a list of the different features and their possible values

fields.name: articleMentions
fields.description: The Articles in which this Generative Token is mentionned

fields.name: moderationReason
fields.description: If any, returns the moderation reason associated with the Generative Token

fields.name: mintTicketSettings
fields.description: The settings for the mint tickets of a Generative Token.

fields.name: underAuctionMintTickets
fields.description: Get all under auction mint tickets for a Generative Token.

fields.name: mintTickets
fields.description: Get the unique mint tickets for a Generative Token.

fields.name: isHolder
fields.description: Whether the supplied address holds a gentk for this token.

fields.name: heldGentks
fields.description: The gentks held by the supplied address for this collection.

fields.name: minLastSoldPrice
fields.description: The minimum price paid by the supplied address for a gentk in this collection.

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: GenerativeTokenVersion
types.description: The version of the generative token

types.name: GenTokFlag
types.description: Flag state of Generative Token

types.name: DateTime
types.description: The javascript `Date` as string. Type represents date and time as the ISO Date string.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of Codex.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The content of the Codex - either an IPFS link to the code or a string containing the actual code.

fields.name: locked
fields.description: Whether the Codex is locked or not.

types.name: Objkt
types.description: Unique iterations of Generative Tokens. They are the NFT entities. Called *Objkt* in the API but is actually a **Gentk** (@ciphrd: my bad there, we're too deep now)

fields.name: slug
fields.description: URL-friendly unique string identifier to reference the Gentk. Computed on-the-fly by the indexer.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The gentk name, derived from the Generative Token and the iteration number: `{generative-token-name} #{iteration-number}`

fields.name: assigned
fields.description: Whether or not this gentk was assigned by the fxhash signer module (if the metadata was set onchain)

fields.name: iteration
fields.description: The iteration number in the collection

fields.name: generationHash
fields.description: The transaction hash which represents the seed used by the Generative Token to generate the unique output

fields.name: duplicate
fields.description: The first version of the contracts had no mechanic to prevent users from making batch calls to mint Generative Tokens. So it resulted in multiple tokens having the similar transaction hash, and thus the same output.
fields.deprecationReason: The indexer doesn't treat duplicates anymore

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: The JSON metadata of the token, extracted from IPFS where it's stored. If the token is not yet signed, will be filled with the generic [WAITING TO BE SIGNED] metadata

fields.name: metadataUri
fields.description: The IPFS uri pointing to the JSON metadata of the token

fields.name: tags
fields.description: A list of tags, set by the author(s) at mint time. Corresponds the the Generative Token tags.

fields.name: features
fields.description: A list of the features, extracted from the source code executed with the unique hash as input.

fields.name: inputBytes
fields.description: The fx(params) input bytes for the token

fields.name: rarity
fields.description: The rarity of the gentk, is expressed by the average of the rarity of each traits. Not very precise.

fields.name: royalties
fields.description: The royalties, which will be redistributed to the artists when a transaction on secondary market occurs. Expressed in per thousands (divide by 10 to get a percentage)

fields.name: version
fields.description: The contract version on which this gentk NFT is stored. (0 = beta contract, 1 = release contract, 2 = post-params contract)

fields.name: displayUri
fields.description: The IPFS URI pointing to the original capture made by the fxhash signer during the signing process. This maps to the `metadata`->`displayUri` of the token.

fields.name: thumbnailUri
fields.description: The IPFS URI pointing to the 300x300 (contained) made by the fxhash signer from the original capture during the signing process. This maps to the `metadata`->`thumbnailUri` of the token.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The time at which the gentk was minted on the blockchain.

fields.name: assignedAt
fields.description: The time at which the metadata of the token was assigned on the blockchain.

fields.name: mintedPrice
fields.description: Price (in tezos) from the first time it has been minted

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique identifier of the objkt.

fields.name: onChainId
fields.description: The on-chain id of the gentk for passing to contract calls.

fields.name: gentkContractAddress
fields.description: The address of the gentk contract that this gentk was minted on.

fields.name: lastSoldPrice
fields.description: The last price this gentk was sold for.

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The current owner of this gentk. The fxhash marketplace contracts are ignored when there's a transfer of ownerhsip to their contracts.

fields.name: minter
fields.description: The user who originally minted this gentk.

fields.name: issuer
fields.description: The generative token from which this gentk was generated.

fields.name: royaltiesSplit
fields.description: A list of the royalties split for this gentk.

fields.name: listings
fields.description: All the listings for the gentk. Includes all the listings related to the gentk, even those which were cancelled / accepted.

fields.name: activeListing
fields.description: The Listing currently active for the gentk, if any.

fields.name: captureMedia
fields.description: The media entity associated with the capture image taken by signer module, provides additional informations on the capture such as resolution, base64 placeholder and media type.

fields.name: offers
fields.description: All the offers for this gentk. Can be filtered.

fields.name: actions
fields.description: The full history of the actions related to the gentk. **Note: this is not optimized for being run on multiple gentks at once, please run it only on endpoints who fetch a single gentk**.

fields.name: redemptions
fields.description: All the single redemption events which occured on this gentk.

fields.name: availableRedeemables
fields.description: A list of the Redeemables for which the token can be redeemed

types.name: ObjktId
types.description: Encapsulates the version and numeric ID for a generative token

types.name: Split
types.description: Describes a generic split (ie: how much shares belong to a given user in any context).

fields.name: pct
fields.description: The per-thousands value associated with the split. Divide by 10 to get percentage.

fields.name: user
fields.description: The user associated with the split.

types.name: Listing
types.description: A Listing on the fxhash secondary market. A polymorphic entity which encapsulates both the listings made on V1 and V2 marketplace contracts.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the listing, corresponds to the ID on the blockchain.

fields.name: version
fields.description: Both listings from the marketplace V1 and V2 contracts are stored in a similar fashion, however this field indicates to which contract the listing belongs. (0 = old marketplace, 1 = new marketplace)

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount of the asset in the listing. For NFTs it will always be 1.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The listing price, **in mutez**

fields.name: royalties
fields.description: The royalties which will be sent to the secondary splits when a sale occurs, per thousands (divide by 10 to get percentage)

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the listing was created by the user

fields.name: cancelledAt
fields.description: When the listing was cancelled by the seller (if null, listing was never cancelled)

fields.name: acceptedAt
fields.description: When the listing was accepted by the buyer (if null, listing was never accepted)

fields.name: issuer
fields.description: The user who made the listing. *If the listing was accepted/cancelled, this may not be equal to the gentk owner*

fields.name: objkt
fields.description: The objkt associated with the listing, if any.

fields.name: article
fields.description: The article associated with the listing, if any.

types.name: Article
types.description: Articles are FA2 assets. Articles were designed not only to support fxhash but also the whole tezos ecosystem.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Unique ID of the article, corresponding to the FA2 bigmap key identifier.

fields.name: slug
fields.description: Unique slug-id for the article, derived from the title.

fields.name: flag
fields.description: Articles can be moderated and their moderation state will reflect in this property.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the article. Maps to the `name` field of the JSON metadata.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Abstract of the article. By default corresponds to the first paragraph but it's not enforced by the spec.

fields.name: body
fields.description: Markdown text which corresponds to the content of the article. Github Flavored Markdown with extended specification to cover the embedding of blockchain content.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: An array of tags, describing the content for search purposes.

fields.name: language
fields.description: The language in which the article was written, RFC 1776 specification.

fields.name: metadataUri
fields.description: IPFS uri pointing to the current on-chain metadata of the article.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: JSON content of the current on-chain metadata of the article. All the fields of the metadata are exposed individually by the Article object to remove the need to fetch this field which may increase payloads.

fields.name: metadataLocked
fields.description: Is the onchain metadata locked ? Locked metadata become immutable.

fields.name: artifactUri
fields.description: IPFS uri pointing to the markdown text content of the article.

fields.name: displayUri
fields.description: IPFS uri pointing to the HQ image preview of the article.

fields.name: thumbnailUri
fields.description: IPFS uri pointing to the LQ image preview of the article.

fields.name: thumbnailCaption
fields.description: An optional caption for the thumbnail.

fields.name: platforms
fields.description: A list of the platforms targetted by the article. To facilitate indexing by the platforms for articles scoped to their content, this field can be used.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Date of mint of the article.

fields.name: editions
fields.description: Number of editions of the semi-fungible FA2 asset.

fields.name: royalties
fields.description: Royalties as set by the minter and defined onchain, in per thousands.

fields.name: mintOpHash
fields.description: The hash of the transaction for minting the FA2 asset.

fields.name: author
fields.description: The author of the article

fields.name: ledger
fields.description: The ledger (owners & editions) of the article.

fields.name: activeListings
fields.description: Get an article active listings.

fields.name: thumbnailMedia
fields.description: The media entity associated with the thumbnail of the article, provides additional informations on the thumbnail such as resolution, base64 placeholder and mime type.

fields.name: generativeTokenMentions
fields.description: The Generative Tokens mentionned by the article.

fields.name: revisions
fields.description: A list of the revisions made to the article.

fields.name: royaltiesSplits
fields.description: The royalty splits.

fields.name: actions
fields.description: A list of all the actions related to the Article. **Not optimized to be run on multiple generative tokens at once, please use carefully*.

fields.name: moderationReason
fields.description: If any, returns the moderation reason associated with the Article

types.name: ArticleFlag
types.description: Flag state of Generative Token

types.name: ArticleLedger
types.description: Articles are semi-fungible FA2 assets, and as such different editions can be owned by different owners. This Object represents an article's on chain ledger.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Amount of editions owned.

fields.name: owner
fields.description: The tezos entity targetted by the entry in the ledger.

fields.name: article
fields.description: The article linked to the ledger entry.

types.name: MediaImage
types.description: The MediaImage object is an abstraction for image elements. To improve the quality and efficiency of fxhash-related applications, the indexer creates a new MediaImage entry with a CID pointing to resource when it finds an image resource, and with the other fields set to null. A side worker will keep looking for unprocessed entries in this table and will process their medias, seeding the entry in the database with usueful information such as a base64 placeholder, resolution and mime type.

fields.name: cid
fields.description: The IPFS CID of the resource

fields.name: width
fields.description: The width of the original image resource, in pixels. If null, the media has not been processed yet.

fields.name: height
fields.description: The height of the original image resource, in pixels. If null, the media has not been processed yet.

fields.name: placeholder
fields.description: A downscaled base64 encoded version of the original image (bilinear filter), contained in a 12x12 square. If null, this media has not been processed yet.

fields.name: mimeType
fields.description: The mime type of the original image. If null, this media has not been processed yet.

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Eventual additional metadata about the image. For now, never populated (will always be null).

fields.name: processed
fields.description: Whether or not this media has been processed by fxhash worker. When true, other fiels of this entity should be populated. If media is marked as `processed`, but fields are still empty, the media could not be processed by the worker.

fields.name: processCounters
fields.description: When the fxhash worker goes through the images, it may sometimes encounter an error and fail. This counter is incremented whenever a fail is encountered. Media will be ignored by the worker once this counter gets too big.

types.name: ArticleGenerativeToken
types.description: Maps articles with Generative Tokens when they're mentionned in an article.

fields.name: line
fields.description: The line in the Markdown file at which the Generative Token is linked by the article.

fields.name: article
fields.description: The article which is mentionning the Generative Token

fields.name: generativeToken
fields.description: The Generative Token mentionned by the Article.

types.name: ArticleRevision
types.description: Articles can be revised by their author. Revisions are all stored.

fields.name: iteration
fields.description: The revision index, starting at 0. At index 0, it corresponds to the mint version.

fields.name: metadataUri
fields.description: IPFS uri pointing to the metadata corresponding to the revision (or original version if 0)

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: Datetime at which the revision was published onchain.

fields.name: opHash
fields.description: Hash of the transaction used to publish the revision onchain.

types.name: Offer
types.description: Users can make offers on particular gentks through the fxhash marketplace v2 contract.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the offer, corresponds to the ID in the marketplace contract

fields.name: version
fields.description: The version of the contract, for now all the offers are on the same contract (1)

fields.name: price
fields.description: The price proposed by the buyer

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The block time when the offer was registerd on the blockchain

fields.name: cancelledAt
fields.description: The block time when the offer was cancelled. If null, the offer was never cancelled. Accepted offer cannot be cancelled.

fields.name: acceptedAt
fields.description: The block time when the offer was accepted by the owner of the gentk. If null, the offer was never accepted. Accepted offer cannot be cancelled.

fields.name: buyer
fields.description: The user who's proposing the offer.

fields.name: objkt
fields.description: The objkt associated with the offer.

types.name: OfferType
types.description: The type of the offer, either individual or collection

types.name: OfferStatus
types.description: The status of the offer

types.name: Redemption
types.description: A redemption is an event recorder when an asset is redeemed on a Redeemable Smart Contract.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Auto-increment ID, unrelated to the blockchain.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the redemption event took place

fields.name: redeemer
fields.description: The user who redeemed

fields.name: redeemable
fields.description: The redeemable associated with this redemption event

types.name: Redeemable
types.description: A Redeemable is a Smart Contract which accepts tokens from a particular project. Those tokens can be redeemed to trigger (on/off)-chain events using onchain verification of the assets ownership.

fields.name: address
fields.description: The address of the Redeemable Smart Contract.

fields.name: baseAmount
fields.description: The base price to redeem an asset, **in mutez**.

fields.name: maxConsumptionsPerToken
fields.description: The maximum number of times an asset can be redeemed.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the Smart Contract was originated.

fields.name: redeemedPercentage
fields.description: What percentage of the total supply has been redeemed

fields.name: splits
fields.description: How the amount being paid when redeeming is split between different parties

fields.name: token
fields.description: The Generative Token which can be used to use this redeemable SC

fields.name: redemptions
fields.description: All the redemption events related to this redeemable SC

inputFields.name: values
inputFields.description: The serialized value, because GraphQL only supports a single type for inputs

inputFields.name: type
inputFields.description: GraphQL doesn't support multiple types as input, so this fields indicates how to process the value

types.name: FeatureType
types.description: The type of the feature, either boolean, string or number

types.name: GenMintProgressFilter
types.description: Filter for the progress of the mint

types.name: CollectionOffer
types.description: Users can make offers on entire collections through the fxhash marketplace v2 contract.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the collection offer, corresponds to the ID in the marketplace contract

fields.name: version
fields.description: The version of the contract, for now all the offers are on the same contract (1)

fields.name: price
fields.description: The price proposed by the buyer

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The number of gentks the buyer wants to buy from the collection

fields.name: initialAmount
fields.description: The initial number of gentks the buyer wants to buy from the collection

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: The block time when the collection offer was registerd on the blockchain

fields.name: cancelledAt
fields.description: The block time when the collection offer was cancelled. If null, the offer was never cancelled. Completed collection offers cannot be cancelled.

fields.name: completedAt
fields.description: The block time when the collection offer was fulfilled. If null, the offer was never fulfilled. Completed collection offers cannot be cancelled.

fields.name: buyer
fields.description: The user who's proposing the offer.

fields.name: token
fields.description: The token associated with the collection offer.

types.name: AnyOffer
types.description: Any offer, either a collection offer or a single gentk offer

types.name: PricingFixed
types.description: Describes the generic **Fixed Pricing** strategy which can be used by authors for their Generative Tokens.

fields.name: price
fields.description: Price, in **mutez**

fields.name: opensAt
fields.description: If any, defines when will the minting of a token be automatically enabled.

types.name: PricingDutchAuction
types.description: Describes a the **Dutch Auction** pricing method which can be used by artists for their Generative Tokens.

fields.name: levels
fields.description: A list of the different pricing levels (in **mutez**), in the right order

fields.name: restingPrice
fields.description: Corresponds to the last level of the Dutch Auction

fields.name: decrementDuration
fields.description: The time between each level, in **seconds**

fields.name: opensAt
fields.description: When the dutch auction will open. This is when the first level of the list will be the active price of a token.

fields.name: finalPrice
fields.description: The price of the last gentk minted during the Dutch Auction. *If null, collection is not fully minted yet*

types.name: Reserve
types.description: Describes the reserves of a Generative Token. Reserves can be used by artists to control the distribution of the tokens more carefully.

fields.name: data
fields.description: A json object which describes the content of the reserve as stored on the blockhain. It should be noted that this data is not stored with relationship with other entities for query efficiency.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount of iterations controlled by the reserve. When reaching 0, the reserve is not active anymore. If someone mints an iteration from the reserve, this counter will decrement.

fields.name: method
fields.description: The reserve method defines the type of the reserve.

types.name: JSON
types.description: The `JSON` scalar type represents JSON values as specified by [ECMA-404](http://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-404.pdf).

types.name: ReserveMethod
types.description: The type of the reserve, describes what it does.

types.name: Report
types.description: Any fxhash user can report any Generative Token, and such report is represented by this entity.

types.name: MarketStats
types.description: The market stats for **Generative Tokens**. Computed periodically by a side-worker.

fields.name: generativeToken
fields.description: The Generative Token associated with the market stats.

types.name: MarketStatsHistory
types.description: The history of the market stats for **Generative Tokens**. Computed and updated periodically by a side-worker.

fields.name: floor
fields.description: The floor of the collection at the end of the range covered

fields.name: median
fields.description: The median of the collection at the end of the range covered

fields.name: listed
fields.description: The number of items listed at the end of the range covered

fields.name: highestSold
fields.description: The highest sale value for an item from the beginning of the collection to the end of the range covered

fields.name: lowestSold
fields.description: The lowest sale value for an item from the beginning of the collection to the end of the range covered

fields.name: primVolumeTz
fields.description: The volume (in tezos) of sales on the primary market during the range covered

fields.name: primVolumeNb
fields.description: The volume (in number) of sales on the primary during the range covered

fields.name: secVolumeTz
fields.description: The volume (in tezos) of sales on the secondary market during the range covered

fields.name: secVolumeNb
fields.description: The volume (in number) of sales on the secondary market during the range covered

fields.name: from
fields.description: The beginning of the range (inclusive) covering those stats [from; to[

fields.name: to
fields.description: The end of the range (exclusive) covering those stats [from; to[

inputFields.name: from
inputFields.description: The beginning (inclusive) of the segment to extract from the history

inputFields.name: to
inputFields.description: The end (exclusive) of the segment to extract from the history

inputFields.name: aggregation
inputFields.description: (NOT IMPLEMENTED YET) The number of hours to aggregate each segment in the results (default 1 hour)

types.name: MintTicketSettings
types.description: The mint ticket settings for a given collection

fields.name: gracingPeriod
fields.description: The number of days after a mint ticket is created before tax is applied to it

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: The JSON metadata of the Mint Ticket Settings, loaded from the ipfs uri associated with the settings when published

fields.name: metadataUri
fields.description: IPFS uri pointing to the JSON metadata of the Mint Ticket Settings

types.name: MintTicket
types.description: A Mint Ticket is a pass that allows a user to mint fx(params) tokens.

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the ticket was created

fields.name: price
fields.description: Price, in **mutez**

fields.name: taxationLocked
fields.description: The amount of tax locked in the ticket

fields.name: taxationStart
fields.description: When the taxation of the ticket will start

fields.name: taxationPaidUntil
fields.description: The date until which the taxation is covered

types.name: GenTokPricing
types.description: The pricing method used by the Generative Token

types.name: MarketStatsData
types.description: An abstraction over the market stats to query the data in a more elegant fashion.

types.name: ListingAssetType
types.description: The type of asset listed.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: The ID of the listing, matches the ID on-chain

inputFields.name: version
inputFields.description: The marketplace contract version on which the Listing was created (old contract = 0, new contract = 1)

types.name: GentkAssign
types.description: Describes the assignation status of a Gentk.

fields.name: state
fields.description: The current assignation state.

fields.name: attempts
fields.description: The number of time the Signer attempter to generate/assign the gentk metadata

fields.name: createdAt
fields.description: When the signer received the gentk for its assignation

fields.name: assignedAt
fields.description: When the signer tagger this gentk as properly assigned

types.name: StatusAssignation
types.description: Represents the status of the assignation module.

fields.name: queueSize
fields.description: The number of gentks in the queue to have their metadata assigned by the signing module.

fields.name: lastAssignedAt
fields.description: The time when the last gentk was assigned.

types.name: IndexingCursor
types.description: A cursor which represents the current position of the indexer (and so the state of the database)

fields.name: level
fields.description: Block level

fields.name: id
fields.description: Operation index

fields.name: originatedAt
fields.description: When the first contract of the group was originated

fields.name: lastIndexedAt
fields.description: When the last operation was indexed

fields.name: users
fields.description: A list of users who match the query string

fields.name: generativeTokens
fields.description: A list of projects which match the query string

inputFields.name: searchQuery_eq
inputFields.description: The string which will be run for the search.

types.name: Profile
types.description: Profile

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the profile.

fields.name: website
fields.description: The website associated with the profile.

fields.name: twitter
fields.description: The twitter handle associated with the profile.

fields.name: instagram
fields.description: The instagram handle asscoiated with the profile.

fields.name: picture
fields.description: The picture associated with the profile.

inputFields.name: website
inputFields.description: The website associated with the profile.

inputFields.name: twitter
inputFields.description: The twitter handle associated with the profile.

inputFields.name: instagram
inputFields.description: The instagram handle associated with the profile.

inputFields.name: picture
inputFields.description: The picture associated with the profile.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
